meanings.definition: Denervates: to deprive (an organ or tissue) of its nerve supply.
meanings.sent1: The surgery denervates the affected area, causing numbness.
meanings.sent2: The dentist denervates the tooth before performing a root canal.
meanings.sent3: The magician denervates the volunteer's hand, making it temporarily numb.
meanings.sent4: The storm denervates the power lines, leaving the town in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The virus denervates the body, disrupting normal functions.

meanings.definition: Denervates: to remove the nerve supply from (a part of the body).
meanings.sent1: The injury denervates the arm, causing loss of sensation.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon denervates the damaged nerve to relieve pain.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally denervates his finger while chopping vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The frost denervates the leaves, turning them brown and withered.
meanings.sent5: The toxin denervates the muscle, leading to weakness.

meanings.sent1: The denervates area of the skin feels numb to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The denervates limb is unable to respond to stimuli.
meanings.sent3: The denervates region of the forest is eerily quiet.
meanings.sent4: The denervates muscle remains flaccid and unresponsive.
meanings.sent5: The denervates organ shows no signs of sensitivity.
